The observable universe is finite, since there's a limit to the amount of light that reaches our eyes since the big bang. There is a proof called "Olber's Paradox", which was established in 1823, that explains pretty simply why our (observable) universe can't be infinite. However, it'll be a long time before we know whether the universe is infinite or not.

It's naive think of the Big Bang as an explosion. Where matter was flung into space from some epicentre. Space and time were created in the Big Bang. Although space may have been concentrated into a single point at the Big Bang, it is equally possible that space was infinite at the Big Bang. It is then very possible that our universe has been filled with matter everywhere since the Big Bang. Hence infinite stars/matter/stuff.
"The universe is infinite" is a dying theory.

"It is known that there are an infinite number of worlds, simply because there is an infinite amount of space for them to be in. However, not every one of them is inhabited. Therefore, there must be a finite number of inhabited worlds. Any finite number divided by infinity is as near to nothing as makes no odds, so the average population of all the planets in the Universe can be said to be zero. From this it follows that the population of the whole Universe is also zero, and that any people you may meet from time to time are merely the products of a deranged imagination."
- Douglas Adams

Quantitative infinity doesn't exist. If our sun vanished you could NOT say that that energy was destroyed because the amount of energy in the universe would still be infinite. Even though energy was clearly lost. Or if you destroyed an infinite number of stars in front of you but left the infinite number of stars behind you alone then you'd still have an infinite number of stars. So, removing one star from infinity equals infinity and removing an infinite number of stars from infinity equals infinity. It's just absurd.

I think this style of video falsely assumes that we are bored by this kind of content and that we need it super fast before we click away. 1) I don't get it

2) I have more questions that won't get answered.
